article.Heading: Union Budget 2017-18: Hope proposed reforms will encourage people to spend, says HCC
article.Summary: Listing his views on the policy announcement, Gulabchand told CNBC-TV18 that the government government has understood that there is a lack of demand and that it must step in to create demand.
article.Body:
The Union Budget announced earlier today had no big negatives, says Ajit Gulabchand CMD, HCC.

Listing his views on the policy announcement, Gulabchand told CNBC-TV18 that the government has understood that there is a lack of demand and that it must step in to create demand.

He said that the changes made for the affordable housing scheme is a big positive and expects the middle-class population to be happy with the tax rate cut.

Today everyone is a bit wary of spending and the reforms proposed in the policy will hopefully encourage people to spend more, he said.

Watch video for more.
